entries.content: Use a hook (a quick question or curiosity-piquing statement) within the first 3 seconds to grab the prospect's attention.
After the hook, qualify the prospect by asking questions to ensure they are the right person and have the capability.
entries.notes: The person asking the questions leads the conversation.

entries.content: Build rapport by asking about the prospect's life or business; people are more likely to buy from those they like.
Present your product or service only after qualifying and building rapport. Keep the presentation short, focused on benefits.
Learn and practice handling common sales objections (like price, time, or 'I need to think about it') instead of getting discouraged.
Directly ask for the business or commitment (the close) after handling objections; do not be afraid to ask.
Follow up with prospects who do not close immediately; a significant amount of business is closed during the follow-up phase.
Ask happy customers for referrals; it is often an easier way to acquire new business compared to cold outreach.
Use confident and excited tonality when speaking, whether on the phone or in person, to project professionalism and engagement.
Maintain good posture (standing or sitting straight) as it contributes to sounding and appearing more confident.
Cultivate strong confidence in yourself and your offering; a lack of confidence is often perceived by prospects.
Develop a robust mindset to handle rejection; do not take 'no' personally and quickly move on to the next opportunity.
Prepare by gaining in-depth knowledge of your product/service, including features, benefits, and competitive differentiation.
Regularly practice your sales scripts, presentations, objection handlers, and closing techniques to improve skills and confidence.
Track key sales metrics (like closing ratio, contacts to appointment) to understand performance and identify areas for improvement.
Be consistent with your daily sales activities; sporadic effort is less effective than steady work.
Remember to have fun during the sales process despite facing difficulties and rejection.
